pullRequest.title: Update doc/examples: BigQuerySource to ReadFromBigQuery
pullRequest.bodyText:
Hi team,
This is a doc only change to update the deprecated (since 2.25.0) BigQuerySource to the new ReadFromBigQuery.
As this is my first contribution, I am not sure if I need to also create a JIRA ticket along with doc only changes. If needed, I can create a ticket later on.
Thanks,
Bin
PS:  I noticed that that the old API is also still used in other places in the codebase 1) integration test codes 2) example/cookbook pipelines. I wonder if I should also update those to the new API?

Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily:

 Choose reviewer(s) and mention them in a comment (R: @username).
 Format the pull request title like [BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles, where you replace BEAM-XXX with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue.
 Update CHANGES.md with noteworthy changes.
 If this contribution is large, please file an Apache Individual Contributor License Agreement.

See the Contributor Guide for more tips on how to make review process smoother.

nodes.bodyText:
To read from a BigQuery table using the Beam SDK for Python, apply a `ReadFromBigQuery`
transfrom. `ReadFromBigQuery` returns a `PCollection` of dictionaries,
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -253,7 +253,7 @@ them into JSON `TableRow` objects.
 
 {{< paragraph class="language-py" >}}
 To read from a BigQuery table using the Beam SDK for Python, apply a `Read`
-transform on a `BigQuerySource`. Read returns a `PCollection` of dictionaries,
+transform on a `ReadFromBigQuery`. Read returns a `PCollection` of dictionaries,
